data.title: Self service although they will bring your food to you even though there is no waitress service.
data.text: Food was very good and the helpings were very generous. They also have some home made deserts and appetizers. Overall the experiance was very good and not to expensive.

data.title: I wish I would have discovered this place years ago
data.text: Good fresh seafood and friendly service.  This restaurant is in an older corner building with glass windows facing both streets.  The décor is old.  It is VERY clean.  There is free parking behind the building or on the street.  You walk up to the counter to place your order and it is then delivered to your table.  This is not the place that you want to bring a first date.   I had baked haddock with a crab topping.  The breading that they use is excellent.  The haddock was fresh and cooked to perfection.  There wasn’t a lot of crab, but they only charged $1 for the crab, so I wasn’t expecting much.  There was a steady flow of customers for take out.  For a Monday night, the place was very busy.   The waitress was very attentive and everyone seemed to know her.  This is definitely a great find and I will be back the next time that I stay in Haverhill.

data.title: good seafood at a great price
data.text:
not a fancy smancy seafood restaurant, but a combo restaurant and fish market. you go to the counter to place your order. one of the greek ladies takes it and your money, and you take away your drink and silverware to your table. shortly food starts arriving. If you're like me, you always order the avgolemono (greek lemon chicken rice soup). Boy do I love it. one of the reasons that I started coming here. So, the soup or your salad arrives, and you start to enjoy your meal then your main dish comes out. I usually get the calamari, which comes on a large platter with rice and greek veggies (stewed tomatoes, onions, sometimes green beans) or a creamy ,tangy coleslaw. Now, some folks shy away from calamari becuase it's like eating rubber bands...not here, succulent and sweet, and so tender that they break apart with your fork. battered and deep fried. yum! they do a shrimp festival that's great- 18 shrimp done 3 ways" 6 fried, 6 scampi and 6 stuffed, along with your choice of 2 sides. they do a killer fried lobster plate, which is the same price as their baked lobster pie (equally tasty) at $22.and both come with 2 sides and bread.. and if you have someone along who doesn't like seafood, they also have chicken selections, burgers and hot dogs.
Some might be put off by the neighborhood, but I've be going to this restaurant for the past 7 years and never had a problem- and it's right across the street from one of the nicest old fashioned neighborhood hardware stores in the area- and a block away from the town library. Give it a try. I think you'll be pleasantly surprised.

data.title: Great Seafood!
data.text: Fresh, local and affordable. Portions are huge. My mom's favorite place for scallops. The hotdog for those who don't like seafood is huge and super affordable. The family size fried haddock dinner can't be beat!

data.title: Don't bother ...
data.text: Yuk!! I couldn't wait to try this place when I moved into Haverhill!  I grew up eating fish & chips from the neighborhood fish market and I'd found out this place had been around for years, so I figured it MUST be great!  WRONG!!!  We went down there, it's in a shady part of town BTW,  The fish didn't taste fresh, the batter wasn't cooked through and the serving size was small.  We are very close to some really good seafood options, so pass on this one and move on.

data.title: Fresh Seafood
data.text: The seafood is well prepared, the menu is diverse, employees are amiable, the prices are good; they do sell sandwiches, as well as chicken for those that don't enjoy fish and seafood.

data.title: Just okay
data.text: Bought fish there and the food is okay, people not so much. I love clams and wouldn't say these were worth the money.

data.title: Great food - EXCELLENT service, always with a smile!
data.text:
The food is always fresh and deliciously made; even the fried food is lightly battered, so you TASTE the fish, not the batter!
The staff is super friendly and makes you feel like family, whether on week nights or busy weekends, they are always welcoming and outgoing.
We do take out at least 3-4 times a month - scrumptious!!!

data.title: Something smells fishy!
data.text: The ABSOLUTE BEST seafood in the downtown Haverhill area!! fish and shrimps, seafood platter, fresh, fresh, fresh!

data.title: smelly fish and stinking service
data.text: staff are rude, the fish smells bad from the street.  we went in for deal that ended at 3pm at 2:50, understanding it was close we offered to pay full price and they said they stopped serving that kind of food completely at 3.  you can smell the old fish just by driving my the restaurant

data.title: Consistently Good Seafood
data.text: The portions are huge, cooked to perfection, and the people make you feel like family! We have been going there for over 10 years now and have never got a bad meal. Its family run, and everyone there is friendly and treats you like you're a long lost cousin! Love it!

data.title: Decent sea food
data.text: We went there with several pople to celebrate a 70th birthday. I had the fried squid with coleslaw and fries. Others had the haddock with shrimp, swordfish and scallops. We called ahead to reserve a table for 7 which they had set up for us. The food was good. I normally have clams but with the price going up I said no. Some of us went home with a doggie bag. we are never disappointed going there. It's nothing fancy there. A local place to eat without having to go to a full serve establishment.

data.title: Lobster and steamers special
data.text: Staff are friendly and pleasant,  price is right,  and the food is to die for.  Try the tasty Greek salad!  Usually served with most meals.

data.title: Great Seafood
data.text:
When I am in this area on business, this is the restaurant I visit.  Tonight I had chowder and fried flounder.  Both were excellent.

Keep in mind this is a combination seafood market/restaurant.  Not a tourist seafood trap.

Very friendly people at the counter.

data.title: Very Good Seafood
data.text: Great takeout. Some seating available. If you don't want to go al the way down to the beach for good seafood, go to Bradford Seafood. Be aware, it's actually now located. In Haverhill.

data.title: Fantastick Fish and Seafood
data.text:
Baked , broiled or fried this is a great little place for fresh seafood. Prices are reasonable and a good selection of side dishes. This is more of a family restaurant nothing fancy but good food.
Baked stuffed haddock and swordfish were very good. Scallops and clams are also delicious.

data.title: Family-Run, Seafood Yummy!
data.text: I always get the broiled Haddock with Tomato and Garlic with Salad sides. The place has a parking lot (free) out back and the service is very friendly! Even a Friday night when the place is packed the service is friendly and fast! We live locally and eat here often! :)

data.title: Fried foods
data.text: A real neighborhood place. The area might look tough but they have parking nearby in their own lot out back. Food is OK. A freindly service help. A local place for average food. A bit oily for me at times so I stay with baked and not fried.

data.title: Great Little Seafood Spot!
data.text: This restaurant had a huge menu of fresh boiled, baked, or fried home style fish selections. I could almost hear the waves crash and the seagulls circling. There were standards for the kids. Also, there is a Greek influence in the recipes such as the Greek vegetables, perfectly seasoned and boiled. The fresh homemade bread "like Mama makes" was a nice break away from the run of the mill restaurants out there. My husband had crab stuffed haddock, myself the almond crusted type. Yum! This is a great place on the way to NH so make it part of your itinerary. It is definitely nice to get a fresh home cooked meal for a reasonable price.

data.title: Fresh and delicious fish
data.text: Really nice little restaurant, family run.  The fish was cooked perfectly and the variety was quite impressive.  Will definately return next time in Haverhill.
